alert.note: Alert for Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 23 at 7:09PM MST until December 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST SATURDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO NOON MST SUNDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM MST Saturday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 6 AM Saturday to Noon MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera
